00.orig_text: Markets dragged down by credit crisis
00.text: Markets dragged down by credit crisis

02.orig_text: Global stock markets fell today, in a mass sell-off stemming from the sub-prime mortgage crisis in the United States.
02.text: Global stock markets fell today, in a mass sell-off stemming from the sub-prime mortgage crisis in the United States.

03.orig_text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rebounded late in the day after falling more than 250 points, ending the day down about 31 points.
03.text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rebounded late in the day after falling more than 250 points, ending the day down about 31 points.

04.orig_text: The UK's FTSE-100 index fell 232.90 points to 6038.30, and Japan's Nikkei 225 fell 406.51 points to 16764.09.
04.text: The UK's FTSE-100 index fell 232.90 points to 6038.30, and Japan's Nikkei 225 fell 406.51 points to 16764.09.

05.orig_text: Central banks across the world are injecting funds into their banking systems to add liquidity, fearing that many financial firms with subprime ties will be insolvent.
05.text: Central banks across the world are injecting funds into their banking systems to add liquidity, fearing that many financial firms with subprime ties will be insolvent.

06.orig_text: Yesterday, the U.S. Federal Reserve transferred US$24 billion to temporary reserves, following the European Central Bank, which authorized a record $83.6 billion addition to its banks, its biggest cash infusion ever.
06.text: Yesterday, the U.S. Federal Reserve transferred US$24 billion to temporary reserves, following the European Central Bank, which authorized a record $83.6 billion addition to its banks, its biggest cash infusion ever.

07.orig_text: On Friday, the Fed entered into a $38 billion repurchase agreement of mortgage-backed securities, easing stockholder worries.
07.text: On Friday, the Fed entered into a $38 billion repurchase agreement of mortgage-backed securities, easing stockholder worries.

08.orig_text: Also on Friday, the Bank of Japan injected ¥1 trillion into Japan's financial system.
08.text: Also on Friday, the Bank of Japan injected ¥1 trillion into Japan's financial system.

09.orig_text: The Federal Reserve met this week, but decided to maintain its target rate of 5.25%, although on Friday the federal funds rate was hovering around 6%, indicating a drop in liquidity.
09.text: The Federal Reserve met this week, but decided to maintain its target rate of 5.25%, although on Friday the federal funds rate was hovering around 6%, indicating a drop in liquidity.

10.orig_text: The volatile week began last Friday with Bear Stearns tumbling as a result from its complete loss of two major hedge funds worth more than $1.5 billion.
10.text: The volatile week began last Friday with Bear Stearns tumbling as a result from its complete loss of two major hedge funds worth more than $1.5 billion.

11.orig_text: The hedge funds had been dangerously exposed to the massive sub-prime mortgage failure, and the company announced it was unable to return any money to investors.
11.text: The hedge funds had been dangerously exposed to the massive sub-prime mortgage failure, and the company announced it was unable to return any money to investors.

12.orig_text: Washington Mutual, and Countrywide Financial, both very large U.S. home loan lenders, saw shares fall.
12.text: Washington Mutual, and Countrywide Financial, both very large U.S. home loan lenders, saw shares fall.

13.orig_text: Countrywide Financial made a statement this week, saying they will be forced to retain a greater proportion of mortgage.
13.text: Countrywide Financial made a statement this week, saying they will be forced to retain a greater proportion of mortgage.

14.orig_text: American Home Mortgage Investment Corp, another large lender, recently filed for bankruptcy.
14.text: American Home Mortgage Investment Corp, another large lender, recently filed for bankruptcy.

15.orig_text: The U.S. housing market has been declining for more than two years after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates 17 times.
15.text: The U.S. housing market has been declining for more than two years after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates 17 times.

16.orig_text: Now, lenders are in a quagmire from millions of people who are unable to repay loans after taking adjustable rate mortgages, teaser rates, interest-only mortgages, or piggyback rates.
16.text: Now, lenders are in a quagmire from millions of people who are unable to repay loans after taking adjustable rate mortgages, teaser rates, interest-only mortgages, or piggyback rates.

17.orig_text: Jim Cramer, of CNBC's Mad Money, remarked that as many as seven million people will lose their homes from bad mortgages.
17.text: Jim Cramer, of CNBC's Mad Money, remarked that as many as seven million people will lose their homes from bad mortgages.

18.orig_text: Last Friday, Cramer went on a tirade on CNBC's Street Signs, saying that the ``Fed was asleep`` and called for them to lower rates immediately.
18.text: Last Friday, Cramer went on a tirade on CNBC's Street Signs, saying that the ``Fed was asleep`` and called for them to lower rates immediately.

19.orig_text: Asian and European markets have become increasingly entangled in the subprime mortgage crisis in the U.S. Deutsche Bank of Germany lost almost $3.5 billion in share value, forcing the government to organize a bail-out.
19.text: Asian and European markets have become increasingly entangled in the subprime mortgage crisis in the U.S. Deutsche Bank of Germany lost almost $3.5 billion in share value, forcing the government to organize a bail-out.

20.orig_text: France's largest bank, BNP Paribas SA, halted withdrawals from three large investment funds which were crippled by sub-prime exposure.
20.text: France's largest bank, BNP Paribas SA, halted withdrawals from three large investment funds which were crippled by sub-prime exposure.

M040.text: many financial firms with subprime ties
